alert.note: Alert for Georgetown (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 5:02PM EDT until July 04 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Georgetown County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 502 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 6.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding may be ongoing in some spots. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pawleys Island, Murrells Inlet, Litchfield Beach and Waccamaw Community Hospital. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause dangerous flooding, especially near creeks and streams, drainage ditches, and low-lying flood prone areas. Turn around, don`t drown if you encounter a flooded road. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away from storm drains, culverts, creeks, and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep you away.
